pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.2: At that time out-of-season robe-cloth had been given to the Sangha of nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.3: and the Sangha gathered to share it out.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.4: Just then the nuns who were pupils of the nun Thullanandā were away.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.6: “Venerables, there are nuns who are away. We cannot distribute the robe-cloth until they get back.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.7: And she blocked the distribution of robe-cloth.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.8: Since the robe-cloth could not be distributed until those nuns returned, other nuns left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.9: Then, when her pupils returned, Thullanandā had that robe-cloth distributed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.10: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.11: “How could Venerable Thullanandā block a legitimate distribution of robe-cloth?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.12: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.15: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.17: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.18.1: ‘If a nun blocks a legitimate distribution of robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.1.6: it is distributed by a unanimous Sangha of nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.1.8: if she blocks it with the thought, “What can be done so that this robe-cloth isn’t distributed?”, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she blocks it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she blocks it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she blocks it, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.4: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.5: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.6: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.3.2: if she blocks it after demonstrating a benefit;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.3.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.3.5: The seventh training rule is finished.
